'''Fethi Ghares''' ({{Langx|ar|فتحي غراس|Fatḥī Ghirās}}; born 20 July 1973) is an Algerian politician. A member of the [[Democratic and Social Movement (Algeria)|Democratic and Social Movement]], which was banned by Algerian authorities in 2023, he has been arrested and imprisoned several times for his activism, particularly his criticisms of the [[President of Algeria]], [[Abdelmadjid Tebboune]].

== Biography ==
Ghares was born in [[Algiers]]. He joined the Democratic and Social Movement upon its formation in 1998, while studying at the agricultural institute in [[Mostaganem]]. He was a member of the party's national bureau until 2013, when he became its official spokesperson.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Abane |first=Meziane |date=20 July 2018 |title=Avec moi, toutes les injustices issues de la décennie noire seront réparées |url=https://www.elwatan.com/edition/actualite/avec-moi-toutes-les-injustices-issues-de-la-decennie-noire-seront-reparees-20-07-2018 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elwatan.com%2Fedition%2Factualite%2Favec-moi-toutes-les-injustices-issues-de-la-decennie-noire-seront-reparees-20-07-2018#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=31 March 2019 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[El Watan]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Guenanfa |first=Hadjer |date=2 May 2018 |title=Entretien avec Fethi Ghares, premier candidat déclaré à la présidentielle de 2019 |url=https://www.tsa-algerie.com/entretien-avec-fethi-ghares-premier-candidat-declare-a-la-presidentielle-de-2019/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tsa-algerie.com%2Fentretien-avec-fethi-ghares-premier-candidat-declare-a-la-presidentielle-de-2019%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=21 February 2025 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=TSA Algérie |language=fr}}</ref> Ghares has described the French West Indian political philosopher [[Frantz Fanon]] as among his biggest influences. In May 2018, he publicly asserted that he supported freedom of conscience, and called for the separation of politics and religion to be enshrined in the [[Constitution of Algeria|Algerian constitution]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Hamouchene |first=Hamza |date=12 June 2021 |title=In Algeria’s Freedom Struggle, the Spirit of Frantz Fanon Is Still Alive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250916232437/https://jacobin.com/2021/12/algeria-frantz-fanon-anti-colonialism-france-oppression-extractivism |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250916232437/https://jacobin.com/2021/12/algeria-frantz-fanon-anti-colonialism-france-oppression-extractivism |archive-date=16 September 2025 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jacobin (magazine)|Jacobin]] |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Alilat |first=Farid |date=28 May 2018 |title=Algérie : Fethi Ghares, l'homme qui veut dépoussiérer la gauche |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/mag/560959/politique/algerie-fethi-ghares-lhomme-qui-veut-depoussierer-la-gauche/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2Fmag%2F560959%2Fpolitique%2Falgerie-fethi-ghares-lhomme-qui-veut-depoussierer-la-gauche%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 October 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref>

Ghares is married to Messaouda Cheballah, a member of the executive secretariat of the Democratic and Social Movement.<ref>{{Cite book |url=https://www.hrw.org/sites/default/files/media_2026/01/WR2026%20web_2.pdf |title=World Report 2026 |publisher=[[Human Rights Watch]] |year=2026 |isbn=979-8-88708-274-5 |location=New York City |language=en |access-date=7 February 2026 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20260204233950/https://www.hrw.org/sites/default/files/media_2026/01/WR2026%20web_2.pdf |archive-date=4 February 2026 |url-status=live}}</ref>

Ghares announced himself as the Democratic and Social Movement candidate for the [[2019 Algerian presidential election]], though did not submit an official dossier of his candidacy.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Moussaoui |first=Rosa |date=16 November 2018 |title=Maghreb. Fethi Ghares, la promesse d'une Algérie émancipée |url=https://www.humanite.fr/monde/maghreb-fethi-ghares-la-promesse-dune-algerie-emancipee-663739 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.humanite.fr%2Fmaghreb-fethi-ghares-la-promesse-dune-algerie-emancipee-663739#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 October 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[L'Humanité]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=21 January 2019 |title=Présidentielle : Le candidat du MDS Fethi Ghares entame les démarches administratives |url=https://www.elwatan.com/edition/actualite/presidentielle-le-candidat-du-mds-fethi-ghares-entame-les-demarches-administratives-21-01-2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elwatan.com%2Fedition%2Factualite%2Fpresidentielle-le-candidat-du-mds-fethi-ghares-entame-les-demarches-administratives-21-01-2019#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=23 May 2019 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[El Watan]] |language=fr}}</ref> Following the outbreak of the [[Hirak (Algeria)|Hirak]] protests, he renounced his candidacy and instead called for an end to the current Algerian political system, to be replaced with a presidium comprised of four or five independent candidates and the installation of a non-partisan transitional government.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Ouahib |first=Sofia |date=24 May 2019 |title=Après les propos d’Ahmed Gaïd Salah sur le maintien de l’élection présidentielle : La riposte du peuple |url=https://www.elwatan.com/edition/actualite/la-riposte-du-peuple-24-05-2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elwatan.com%2Fedition%2Factualite%2Fla-riposte-du-peuple-24-05-2019#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 May 2019 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[El Watan]] |language=fr}}</ref>

In addition to politics, Ghares has also acted in films, including a leading role in ''Révolution Zendj'' by [[Tariq Teguia]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Regnier |first=Isabelle |date=4 March 2015 |title=« Révolution Zendj » : sous la poussière, les braises des soulèvements passés |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/cinema/article/2015/03/10/revolution-zendj-sous-la-poussiere-les-braises-des-soulevements-passes_4590750_3476.html |url-status=live |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Monde]] |language=fr}}</ref>

=== 2021 arrest and imprisonment ===
On 30 June 2021, Ghares was arrested at his home in [[Djasr Kasentina]] by plainclothes police officers. The [[National Committee for the Liberation of Detainees]] subsequently issued a press release which alleged that, after initially being taken to a police station, Ghares had been returned to his home in order for a search to take place, before being transported to an unknown location.<ref>{{Cite news |date=30 June 2021 |title=Fethi Ghares, président du MDS, arrêté chez lui (CNLD) |url=https://observalgerie.com/2021/06/30/politique/cnld-fethi-ghares-arrete-police/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.observalgerie.com%2F2021%2F06%2F30%2Fpolitique%2Fcnld-fethi-ghares-arrete-police%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 October 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=ObservAlgérie |language=fr}}</ref>

On 1 July 2021, Ghares was ordered into pretrial detention by a judge at a court in [[Hammamet, Algiers|Hammamet]].<ref>{{Cite news |date=1 July 2021 |title=URGENT : Fethi Ghares placé sous mandat de dépôt (CNLD) |url=https://observalgerie.com/2021/07/01/politique/cnld-algerie-fethi-ghares-prison/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.observalgerie.com%2F2021%2F07%2F01%2Fpolitique%2Fcnld-algerie-fethi-ghares-prison%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=11 February 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=ObservAlgérie |language=fr}}</ref> His trial was originally scheduled to begin on 6 December, before being delayed to 12 December.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Sankari |first=Lina |date=6 December 2021 |title=Algérie. Fethi Ghares, incarcéré pour ses idées |url=https://www.humanite.fr/algerie-fethi-ghares-incarcere-pour-ses-idees-730102 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.humanite.fr%2Falgerie-fethi-ghares-incarcere-pour-ses-idees-730102#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=13 January 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[L'Humanité]] |language=fr}}</ref> On 9 January 2022, Ghares was sentenced to two years imprisonment on charges of "insulting the President of the Republic", "contempt of a constitutional body", "disseminating publications that could harm the national unity", and "disseminating information that could harm public order". The sentence was criticised by the opposition movement in Algeria.<ref>{{Cite news |date=9 January 2022 |title=Condamnation de Fethi Ghares : les réactions de l'opposition |url=https://www.tsa-algerie.com/condamnation-de-fethi-ghares-les-reactions-de-lopposition/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tsa-algerie.com%2Fcondamnation-de-fethi-ghares-les-reactions-de-lopposition%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=24 March 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=TSA Algérie |language=fr}}</ref>

In March 2022, Ghares' sentence was reduced to six months imprisonment following a successful appeal, which led to his immediate release from prison. He subsequently publicly commented on conditions at [[El Harrach]] Prison, describing it as "medieval" and stating that no one left it "unscathed".<ref>{{Cite news |last=Alilat |first=Farid |date=28 March 2022 |title=Algérie : Fethi Ghares raconte la prison d'El Harrach |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1334057/politique/algerieaf-fethi-ghares-raconte-la-prison-del-harrach/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2F1334057%2Fpolitique%2Falgerieaf-fethi-ghares-raconte-la-prison-del-harrach%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=9 April 2025 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref>

In February 2023, the Democratic and Social Movement was banned.<ref>{{Cite news |date=29 August 2024 |title=Algérie: l’opposant Fethi Ghares remis en liberté sous contrôle judiciaire |url=https://www.mediapart.fr/journal/fil-dactualites/290824/algerie-l-opposant-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mediapart.fr%2Fjournal%2Ffil-dactualites%2F290824%2Falgerie-l-opposant-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Mediapart]] |language=fr}}</ref>

=== 2024 arrest and imprisonment ===
On 27 August 2024, Ghares was arrested by plainclothes police officers and transported to an unknown location, according to his wife and the National Committee for the Liberation of Detainees. The arrest happened 15 days before the [[2024 Algerian presidential election]], in which Abdelmadjid Tebboune was seeking a second term. Ghares was accused of "disrupting the election".<ref>{{Cite news |date=28 August 2024 |title=Arrestation de l’opposant algérien Fethi Ghares |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1602576/politique/arrestation-de-lopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2F1602576%2Fpolitique%2Farrestation-de-lopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=K. |first=Yacine |title=Fethi Ghares (coordinateur du MDS) enlevé! |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-coordinateur-du-mds-enleve/?amp=1 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-coordinateur-du-mds-enleve%2F%3Famp%3D1#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=K. |first=Yacine |date=28 August 2024 |title=Fethi Ghares retenu au commissariat central d'Alger |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-retenu-au-commissariat-central-dalger/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-retenu-au-commissariat-central-dalger%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref>

On 29 August 2024, Ghares was charged with "insulting the president" and "spreading false information and hate speech through social media posts". He was released from custody and placed under judicial supervision.<ref>{{Cite news |date=30 August 2024 |title=L’opposant algérien Fethi Ghares remis en liberté sous contrôle judiciaire |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1603472/politique/lopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2F1603472%2Fpolitique%2Flopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire%2F#& |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref> In January 2025, Ghares was sentenced to one year in prison and ordered to pay symbolic damages of one [[Algerian dinar|DZD]] to President Tebboune. Ghares' wife received a six-month suspended sentence.<ref>{{Cite news |last=H. |first=Amel |date=19 January 2025 |title=Fethi Ghares et son épouse condamnés à prison ferme pour avoir entravé le processus électoral |url=https://www.algerie360.com/fethi-ghares-et-son-epouse-condamnes-a-prison-ferme-pour-avoir-entrave-le-processus-electoral/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.algerie360.com%2Ffethi-ghares-et-son-epouse-condamnes-a-prison-ferme-pour-avoir-entrave-le-processus-electoral%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=Algerie360 |language=fr}}</ref>

=== 2025 arrest and imprisonment ===
On 29 September 2025, Ghares was arrested for a third time at his home for "insulting the President of the Republic".<ref>{{Cite news |last=Ayache |first=Sofiane |date=29 September 2025 |title=Fethi Ghares arrêté par la police |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-arrete-par-la-police/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-arrete-par-la-police%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref> In October 2025, he was found guilty of "insulting a constituted body" and "disseminating false information undermining public order and national security", and was sentenced to two years imprisonment and a fine of 300, 000 DZD. Ghares remained on provisional release pending the outcome of his appeal of the sentence.<ref>{{Cite news |date=21 October 2025 |title=Fethi Gharès condamné à deux ans de prison ferme |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=21 October 2025 |title=Algérie : un opposant de gauche condamné à deux ans de prison ferme pour outrage au président |url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-actu/algerie-un-opposant-de-gauche-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme-pour-outrage-au-president-20251021 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lefigaro.fr%2Fflash-actu%2Falgerie-un-opposant-de-gauche-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme-pour-outrage-au-president-20251021#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Figaro]] |language=fr}}</ref>

'''Fethi Ghares''' ({{Langx|ar|فتحي غراس|Fatḥī Ghirās}}; born 20 July 1973) is an Algerian politician. A member of the [[Democratic and Social Movement (Algeria)|Democratic and Social Movement]], which was banned by Algerian authorities in 2023, he has been arrested and imprisoned several times for his activism, particularly his criticisms of the [[President of Algeria]], [[Abdelmadjid Tebboune]].

== Biography ==
Ghares was born in [[Algiers]]. He joined the Democratic and Social Movement upon its formation in 1998, while studying at the agricultural institute in [[Mostaganem]]. He was a member of the party's national bureau until 2013, when he became its official spokesperson.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Abane |first=Meziane |date=20 July 2018 |title=Avec moi, toutes les injustices issues de la décennie noire seront réparées |url=https://www.elwatan.com/edition/actualite/avec-moi-toutes-les-injustices-issues-de-la-decennie-noire-seront-reparees-20-07-2018 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elwatan.com%2Fedition%2Factualite%2Favec-moi-toutes-les-injustices-issues-de-la-decennie-noire-seront-reparees-20-07-2018#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=31 March 2019 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[El Watan]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Guenanfa |first=Hadjer |date=2 May 2018 |title=Entretien avec Fethi Ghares, premier candidat déclaré à la présidentielle de 2019 |url=https://www.tsa-algerie.com/entretien-avec-fethi-ghares-premier-candidat-declare-a-la-presidentielle-de-2019/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tsa-algerie.com%2Fentretien-avec-fethi-ghares-premier-candidat-declare-a-la-presidentielle-de-2019%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=21 February 2025 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=TSA Algérie |language=fr}}</ref> Ghares has described the French West Indian political philosopher [[Frantz Fanon]] as among his biggest influences. In May 2018, he publicly asserted that he supported freedom of conscience, and called for the separation of politics and religion to be enshrined in the [[Constitution of Algeria|Algerian constitution]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Hamouchene |first=Hamza |date=12 June 2021 |title=In Algeria’s Freedom Struggle, the Spirit of Frantz Fanon Is Still Alive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250916232437/https://jacobin.com/2021/12/algeria-frantz-fanon-anti-colonialism-france-oppression-extractivism |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250916232437/https://jacobin.com/2021/12/algeria-frantz-fanon-anti-colonialism-france-oppression-extractivism |archive-date=16 September 2025 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jacobin (magazine)|Jacobin]] |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Alilat |first=Farid |date=28 May 2018 |title=Algérie : Fethi Ghares, l'homme qui veut dépoussiérer la gauche |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/mag/560959/politique/algerie-fethi-ghares-lhomme-qui-veut-depoussierer-la-gauche/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2Fmag%2F560959%2Fpolitique%2Falgerie-fethi-ghares-lhomme-qui-veut-depoussierer-la-gauche%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 October 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref>

Ghares is married to Messaouda Cheballah, a member of the executive secretariat of the Democratic and Social Movement.<ref>{{Cite book |url=https://www.hrw.org/sites/default/files/media_2026/01/WR2026%20web_2.pdf |title=World Report 2026 |publisher=[[Human Rights Watch]] |year=2026 |isbn=979-8-88708-274-5 |location=New York City |language=en |access-date=7 February 2026 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20260204233950/https://www.hrw.org/sites/default/files/media_2026/01/WR2026%20web_2.pdf |archive-date=4 February 2026 |url-status=live}}</ref>

Ghares announced himself as the Democratic and Social Movement candidate for the [[2019 Algerian presidential election]], though did not submit an official dossier of his candidacy.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Moussaoui |first=Rosa |date=16 November 2018 |title=Maghreb. Fethi Ghares, la promesse d'une Algérie émancipée |url=https://www.humanite.fr/monde/maghreb-fethi-ghares-la-promesse-dune-algerie-emancipee-663739 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.humanite.fr%2Fmaghreb-fethi-ghares-la-promesse-dune-algerie-emancipee-663739#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 October 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[L'Humanité]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=21 January 2019 |title=Présidentielle : Le candidat du MDS Fethi Ghares entame les démarches administratives |url=https://www.elwatan.com/edition/actualite/presidentielle-le-candidat-du-mds-fethi-ghares-entame-les-demarches-administratives-21-01-2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elwatan.com%2Fedition%2Factualite%2Fpresidentielle-le-candidat-du-mds-fethi-ghares-entame-les-demarches-administratives-21-01-2019#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=23 May 2019 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[El Watan]] |language=fr}}</ref> Following the outbreak of the [[Hirak (Algeria)|Hirak]] protests, he renounced his candidacy and instead called for an end to the current Algerian political system, to be replaced with a presidium comprised of four or five independent candidates and the installation of a non-partisan transitional government.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Ouahib |first=Sofia |date=24 May 2019 |title=Après les propos d’Ahmed Gaïd Salah sur le maintien de l’élection présidentielle : La riposte du peuple |url=https://www.elwatan.com/edition/actualite/la-riposte-du-peuple-24-05-2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elwatan.com%2Fedition%2Factualite%2Fla-riposte-du-peuple-24-05-2019#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 May 2019 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[El Watan]] |language=fr}}</ref>

In addition to politics, Ghares has also acted in films, including a leading role in ''Révolution Zendj'' by [[Tariq Teguia]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Regnier |first=Isabelle |date=4 March 2015 |title=« Révolution Zendj » : sous la poussière, les braises des soulèvements passés |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/cinema/article/2015/03/10/revolution-zendj-sous-la-poussiere-les-braises-des-soulevements-passes_4590750_3476.html |url-status=live |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Monde]] |language=fr}}</ref>

=== 2021 arrest and imprisonment ===
On 30 June 2021, Ghares was arrested at his home in [[Djasr Kasentina]] by plainclothes police officers. The [[National Committee for the Liberation of Detainees]] subsequently issued a press release which alleged that, after initially being taken to a police station, Ghares had been returned to his home in order for a search to take place, before being transported to an unknown location.<ref>{{Cite news |date=30 June 2021 |title=Fethi Ghares, président du MDS, arrêté chez lui (CNLD) |url=https://observalgerie.com/2021/06/30/politique/cnld-fethi-ghares-arrete-police/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.observalgerie.com%2F2021%2F06%2F30%2Fpolitique%2Fcnld-fethi-ghares-arrete-police%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 October 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=ObservAlgérie |language=fr}}</ref>

On 1 July 2021, Ghares was ordered into pretrial detention by a judge at a court in [[Hammamet, Algiers|Hammamet]].<ref>{{Cite news |date=1 July 2021 |title=URGENT : Fethi Ghares placé sous mandat de dépôt (CNLD) |url=https://observalgerie.com/2021/07/01/politique/cnld-algerie-fethi-ghares-prison/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.observalgerie.com%2F2021%2F07%2F01%2Fpolitique%2Fcnld-algerie-fethi-ghares-prison%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=11 February 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=ObservAlgérie |language=fr}}</ref> His trial was originally scheduled to begin on 6 December, before being delayed to 12 December.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Sankari |first=Lina |date=6 December 2021 |title=Algérie. Fethi Ghares, incarcéré pour ses idées |url=https://www.humanite.fr/algerie-fethi-ghares-incarcere-pour-ses-idees-730102 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.humanite.fr%2Falgerie-fethi-ghares-incarcere-pour-ses-idees-730102#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=13 January 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[L'Humanité]] |language=fr}}</ref> On 9 January 2022, Ghares was sentenced to two years imprisonment on charges of "insulting the President of the Republic", "contempt of a constitutional body", "disseminating publications that could harm the national unity", and "disseminating information that could harm public order". The sentence was criticised by the opposition movement in Algeria.<ref>{{Cite news |date=9 January 2022 |title=Condamnation de Fethi Ghares : les réactions de l'opposition |url=https://www.tsa-algerie.com/condamnation-de-fethi-ghares-les-reactions-de-lopposition/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tsa-algerie.com%2Fcondamnation-de-fethi-ghares-les-reactions-de-lopposition%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=24 March 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=TSA Algérie |language=fr}}</ref>

In March 2022, Ghares' sentence was reduced to six months imprisonment following a successful appeal, which led to his immediate release from prison. He subsequently publicly commented on conditions at [[El Harrach]] Prison, describing it as "medieval" and stating that no one left it "unscathed".<ref>{{Cite news |last=Alilat |first=Farid |date=28 March 2022 |title=Algérie : Fethi Ghares raconte la prison d'El Harrach |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1334057/politique/algerieaf-fethi-ghares-raconte-la-prison-del-harrach/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2F1334057%2Fpolitique%2Falgerieaf-fethi-ghares-raconte-la-prison-del-harrach%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=9 April 2025 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref>

In February 2023, the Democratic and Social Movement was banned.<ref>{{Cite news |date=29 August 2024 |title=Algérie: l’opposant Fethi Ghares remis en liberté sous contrôle judiciaire |url=https://www.mediapart.fr/journal/fil-dactualites/290824/algerie-l-opposant-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mediapart.fr%2Fjournal%2Ffil-dactualites%2F290824%2Falgerie-l-opposant-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Mediapart]] |language=fr}}</ref>

=== 2024 arrest and imprisonment ===
On 27 August 2024, Ghares was arrested by plainclothes police officers and transported to an unknown location, according to his wife and the National Committee for the Liberation of Detainees. The arrest happened 15 days before the [[2024 Algerian presidential election]], in which Abdelmadjid Tebboune was seeking a second term. Ghares was accused of "disrupting the election".<ref>{{Cite news |date=28 August 2024 |title=Arrestation de l’opposant algérien Fethi Ghares |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1602576/politique/arrestation-de-lopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2F1602576%2Fpolitique%2Farrestation-de-lopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=K. |first=Yacine |title=Fethi Ghares (coordinateur du MDS) enlevé! |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-coordinateur-du-mds-enleve/?amp=1 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-coordinateur-du-mds-enleve%2F%3Famp%3D1#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=K. |first=Yacine |date=28 August 2024 |title=Fethi Ghares retenu au commissariat central d'Alger |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-retenu-au-commissariat-central-dalger/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-retenu-au-commissariat-central-dalger%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref>

On 29 August 2024, Ghares was charged with "insulting the president" and "spreading false information and hate speech through social media posts". He was released from custody and placed under judicial supervision.<ref>{{Cite news |date=30 August 2024 |title=L’opposant algérien Fethi Ghares remis en liberté sous contrôle judiciaire |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1603472/politique/lopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2F1603472%2Fpolitique%2Flopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire%2F#& |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref> In January 2025, Ghares was sentenced to one year in prison and ordered to pay symbolic damages of one [[Algerian dinar|DZD]] to President Tebboune. Ghares' wife received a six-month suspended sentence.<ref>{{Cite news |last=H. |first=Amel |date=19 January 2025 |title=Fethi Ghares et son épouse condamnés à prison ferme pour avoir entravé le processus électoral |url=https://www.algerie360.com/fethi-ghares-et-son-epouse-condamnes-a-prison-ferme-pour-avoir-entrave-le-processus-electoral/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.algerie360.com%2Ffethi-ghares-et-son-epouse-condamnes-a-prison-ferme-pour-avoir-entrave-le-processus-electoral%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=Algerie360 |language=fr}}</ref>

=== 2025 arrest and imprisonment ===
On 29 September 2025, Ghares was arrested for a third time at his home for "insulting the President of the Republic".<ref>{{Cite news |last=Ayache |first=Sofiane |date=29 September 2025 |title=Fethi Ghares arrêté par la police |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-arrete-par-la-police/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-arrete-par-la-police%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref> In October 2025, he was found guilty of "insulting a constituted body" and "disseminating false information undermining public order and national security", and was sentenced to two years imprisonment and a fine of 300, 000 DZD. Ghares remained on provisional release pending the outcome of his appeal of the sentence.<ref>{{Cite news |date=21 October 2025 |title=Fethi Gharès condamné à deux ans de prison ferme |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=21 October 2025 |title=Algérie : un opposant de gauche condamné à deux ans de prison ferme pour outrage au président |url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-actu/algerie-un-opposant-de-gauche-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme-pour-outrage-au-president-20251021 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lefigaro.fr%2Fflash-actu%2Falgerie-un-opposant-de-gauche-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme-pour-outrage-au-president-20251021#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Figaro]] |language=fr}}</ref>

'''Fethi Ghares''' ({{Langx|ar|فتحي غراس|Fatḥī Ghirās}}; born 20 July 1973) is an Algerian politician. A member of the [[Democratic and Social Movement (Algeria)|Democratic and Social Movement]], which was banned by Algerian authorities in 2023, he has been arrested and imprisoned several times for his activism, particularly his criticisms of the [[President of Algeria]], [[Abdelmadjid Tebboune]].

== Biography ==
Ghares was born in [[Algiers]]. He joined the Democratic and Social Movement upon its formation in 1998, while studying at the agricultural institute in [[Mostaganem]]. He was a member of the party's national bureau until 2013, when he became its official spokesperson.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Abane |first=Meziane |date=20 July 2018 |title=Avec moi, toutes les injustices issues de la décennie noire seront réparées |url=https://www.elwatan.com/edition/actualite/avec-moi-toutes-les-injustices-issues-de-la-decennie-noire-seront-reparees-20-07-2018 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elwatan.com%2Fedition%2Factualite%2Favec-moi-toutes-les-injustices-issues-de-la-decennie-noire-seront-reparees-20-07-2018#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=31 March 2019 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[El Watan]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Guenanfa |first=Hadjer |date=2 May 2018 |title=Entretien avec Fethi Ghares, premier candidat déclaré à la présidentielle de 2019 |url=https://www.tsa-algerie.com/entretien-avec-fethi-ghares-premier-candidat-declare-a-la-presidentielle-de-2019/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tsa-algerie.com%2Fentretien-avec-fethi-ghares-premier-candidat-declare-a-la-presidentielle-de-2019%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=21 February 2025 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=TSA Algérie |language=fr}}</ref> Ghares has described the French West Indian political philosopher [[Frantz Fanon]] as among his biggest influences. In May 2018, he publicly asserted that he supported freedom of conscience, and called for the separation of politics and religion to be enshrined in the [[Constitution of Algeria|Algerian constitution]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Hamouchene |first=Hamza |date=12 June 2021 |title=In Algeria’s Freedom Struggle, the Spirit of Frantz Fanon Is Still Alive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250916232437/https://jacobin.com/2021/12/algeria-frantz-fanon-anti-colonialism-france-oppression-extractivism |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250916232437/https://jacobin.com/2021/12/algeria-frantz-fanon-anti-colonialism-france-oppression-extractivism |archive-date=16 September 2025 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jacobin (magazine)|Jacobin]] |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Alilat |first=Farid |date=28 May 2018 |title=Algérie : Fethi Ghares, l'homme qui veut dépoussiérer la gauche |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/mag/560959/politique/algerie-fethi-ghares-lhomme-qui-veut-depoussierer-la-gauche/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2Fmag%2F560959%2Fpolitique%2Falgerie-fethi-ghares-lhomme-qui-veut-depoussierer-la-gauche%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 October 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref>

Ghares is married to Messaouda Cheballah, a member of the executive secretariat of the Democratic and Social Movement.<ref>{{Cite book |url=https://www.hrw.org/sites/default/files/media_2026/01/WR2026%20web_2.pdf |title=World Report 2026 |publisher=[[Human Rights Watch]] |year=2026 |isbn=979-8-88708-274-5 |location=New York City |language=en |access-date=7 February 2026 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20260204233950/https://www.hrw.org/sites/default/files/media_2026/01/WR2026%20web_2.pdf |archive-date=4 February 2026 |url-status=live}}</ref>

Ghares announced himself as the Democratic and Social Movement candidate for the [[2019 Algerian presidential election]], though did not submit an official dossier of his candidacy.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Moussaoui |first=Rosa |date=16 November 2018 |title=Maghreb. Fethi Ghares, la promesse d'une Algérie émancipée |url=https://www.humanite.fr/monde/maghreb-fethi-ghares-la-promesse-dune-algerie-emancipee-663739 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.humanite.fr%2Fmaghreb-fethi-ghares-la-promesse-dune-algerie-emancipee-663739#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 October 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[L'Humanité]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=21 January 2019 |title=Présidentielle : Le candidat du MDS Fethi Ghares entame les démarches administratives |url=https://www.elwatan.com/edition/actualite/presidentielle-le-candidat-du-mds-fethi-ghares-entame-les-demarches-administratives-21-01-2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elwatan.com%2Fedition%2Factualite%2Fpresidentielle-le-candidat-du-mds-fethi-ghares-entame-les-demarches-administratives-21-01-2019#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=23 May 2019 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[El Watan]] |language=fr}}</ref> Following the outbreak of the [[Hirak (Algeria)|Hirak]] protests, he renounced his candidacy and instead called for an end to the current Algerian political system, to be replaced with a presidium comprised of four or five independent candidates and the installation of a non-partisan transitional government.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Ouahib |first=Sofia |date=24 May 2019 |title=Après les propos d’Ahmed Gaïd Salah sur le maintien de l’élection présidentielle : La riposte du peuple |url=https://www.elwatan.com/edition/actualite/la-riposte-du-peuple-24-05-2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elwatan.com%2Fedition%2Factualite%2Fla-riposte-du-peuple-24-05-2019#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 May 2019 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[El Watan]] |language=fr}}</ref>

In addition to politics, Ghares has also acted in films, including a leading role in ''Révolution Zendj'' by [[Tariq Teguia]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Regnier |first=Isabelle |date=4 March 2015 |title=« Révolution Zendj » : sous la poussière, les braises des soulèvements passés |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/cinema/article/2015/03/10/revolution-zendj-sous-la-poussiere-les-braises-des-soulevements-passes_4590750_3476.html |url-status=live |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Monde]] |language=fr}}</ref>

=== 2021 arrest and imprisonment ===
On 30 June 2021, Ghares was arrested at his home in [[Djasr Kasentina]] by plainclothes police officers. The [[National Committee for the Liberation of Detainees]] subsequently issued a press release which alleged that, after initially being taken to a police station, Ghares had been returned to his home in order for a search to take place, before being transported to an unknown location.<ref>{{Cite news |date=30 June 2021 |title=Fethi Ghares, président du MDS, arrêté chez lui (CNLD) |url=https://observalgerie.com/2021/06/30/politique/cnld-fethi-ghares-arrete-police/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.observalgerie.com%2F2021%2F06%2F30%2Fpolitique%2Fcnld-fethi-ghares-arrete-police%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 October 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=ObservAlgérie |language=fr}}</ref>

On 1 July 2021, Ghares was ordered into pretrial detention by a judge at a court in [[Hammamet, Algiers|Hammamet]].<ref>{{Cite news |date=1 July 2021 |title=URGENT : Fethi Ghares placé sous mandat de dépôt (CNLD) |url=https://observalgerie.com/2021/07/01/politique/cnld-algerie-fethi-ghares-prison/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.observalgerie.com%2F2021%2F07%2F01%2Fpolitique%2Fcnld-algerie-fethi-ghares-prison%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=11 February 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=ObservAlgérie |language=fr}}</ref> His trial was originally scheduled to begin on 6 December, before being delayed to 12 December.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Sankari |first=Lina |date=6 December 2021 |title=Algérie. Fethi Ghares, incarcéré pour ses idées |url=https://www.humanite.fr/algerie-fethi-ghares-incarcere-pour-ses-idees-730102 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.humanite.fr%2Falgerie-fethi-ghares-incarcere-pour-ses-idees-730102#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=13 January 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[L'Humanité]] |language=fr}}</ref> On 9 January 2022, Ghares was sentenced to two years imprisonment on charges of "insulting the President of the Republic", "contempt of a constitutional body", "disseminating publications that could harm the national unity", and "disseminating information that could harm public order". The sentence was criticised by the opposition movement in Algeria.<ref>{{Cite news |date=9 January 2022 |title=Condamnation de Fethi Ghares : les réactions de l'opposition |url=https://www.tsa-algerie.com/condamnation-de-fethi-ghares-les-reactions-de-lopposition/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tsa-algerie.com%2Fcondamnation-de-fethi-ghares-les-reactions-de-lopposition%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=24 March 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=TSA Algérie |language=fr}}</ref>

In March 2022, Ghares' sentence was reduced to six months imprisonment following a successful appeal, which led to his immediate release from prison. He subsequently publicly commented on conditions at [[El Harrach]] Prison, describing it as "medieval" and stating that no one left it "unscathed".<ref>{{Cite news |last=Alilat |first=Farid |date=28 March 2022 |title=Algérie : Fethi Ghares raconte la prison d'El Harrach |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1334057/politique/algerieaf-fethi-ghares-raconte-la-prison-del-harrach/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2F1334057%2Fpolitique%2Falgerieaf-fethi-ghares-raconte-la-prison-del-harrach%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=9 April 2025 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref>

In February 2023, the Democratic and Social Movement was banned.<ref>{{Cite news |date=29 August 2024 |title=Algérie: l’opposant Fethi Ghares remis en liberté sous contrôle judiciaire |url=https://www.mediapart.fr/journal/fil-dactualites/290824/algerie-l-opposant-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mediapart.fr%2Fjournal%2Ffil-dactualites%2F290824%2Falgerie-l-opposant-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Mediapart]] |language=fr}}</ref>

=== 2024 arrest and imprisonment ===
On 27 August 2024, Ghares was arrested by plainclothes police officers and transported to an unknown location, according to his wife and the National Committee for the Liberation of Detainees. The arrest happened 15 days before the [[2024 Algerian presidential election]], in which Abdelmadjid Tebboune was seeking a second term. Ghares was accused of "disrupting the election".<ref>{{Cite news |date=28 August 2024 |title=Arrestation de l’opposant algérien Fethi Ghares |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1602576/politique/arrestation-de-lopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2F1602576%2Fpolitique%2Farrestation-de-lopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=K. |first=Yacine |title=Fethi Ghares (coordinateur du MDS) enlevé! |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-coordinateur-du-mds-enleve/?amp=1 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-coordinateur-du-mds-enleve%2F%3Famp%3D1#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=K. |first=Yacine |date=28 August 2024 |title=Fethi Ghares retenu au commissariat central d'Alger |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-retenu-au-commissariat-central-dalger/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-retenu-au-commissariat-central-dalger%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref>

On 29 August 2024, Ghares was charged with "insulting the president" and "spreading false information and hate speech through social media posts". He was released from custody and placed under judicial supervision.<ref>{{Cite news |date=30 August 2024 |title=L’opposant algérien Fethi Ghares remis en liberté sous contrôle judiciaire |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1603472/politique/lopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2F1603472%2Fpolitique%2Flopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire%2F#& |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref> In January 2025, Ghares was sentenced to one year in prison and ordered to pay symbolic damages of one [[Algerian dinar|DZD]] to President Tebboune. Ghares' wife received a six-month suspended sentence.<ref>{{Cite news |last=H. |first=Amel |date=19 January 2025 |title=Fethi Ghares et son épouse condamnés à prison ferme pour avoir entravé le processus électoral |url=https://www.algerie360.com/fethi-ghares-et-son-epouse-condamnes-a-prison-ferme-pour-avoir-entrave-le-processus-electoral/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.algerie360.com%2Ffethi-ghares-et-son-epouse-condamnes-a-prison-ferme-pour-avoir-entrave-le-processus-electoral%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=Algerie360 |language=fr}}</ref>

=== 2025 arrest and imprisonment ===
On 29 September 2025, Ghares was arrested for a third time at his home for "insulting the President of the Republic".<ref>{{Cite news |last=Ayache |first=Sofiane |date=29 September 2025 |title=Fethi Ghares arrêté par la police |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-arrete-par-la-police/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-arrete-par-la-police%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref> In October 2025, he was found guilty of "insulting a constituted body" and "disseminating false information undermining public order and national security", and was sentenced to two years imprisonment and a fine of 300, 000 DZD. Ghares remained on provisional release pending the outcome of his appeal of the sentence.<ref>{{Cite news |date=21 October 2025 |title=Fethi Gharès condamné à deux ans de prison ferme |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=21 October 2025 |title=Algérie : un opposant de gauche condamné à deux ans de prison ferme pour outrage au président |url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-actu/algerie-un-opposant-de-gauche-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme-pour-outrage-au-president-20251021 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lefigaro.fr%2Fflash-actu%2Falgerie-un-opposant-de-gauche-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme-pour-outrage-au-president-20251021#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Figaro]] |language=fr}}</ref>

'''Fethi Ghares''' ({{Langx|ar|فتحي غراس|Fatḥī Ghirās}}; born 20 July 1973) is an Algerian politician. A member of the [[Democratic and Social Movement (Algeria)|Democratic and Social Movement]], which was banned by Algerian authorities in 2023, he has been arrested and imprisoned several times for his activism, particularly his criticisms of the [[President of Algeria]], [[Abdelmadjid Tebboune]].

== Biography ==
Ghares was born in [[Algiers]]. He joined the Democratic and Social Movement upon its formation in 1998, while studying at the agricultural institute in [[Mostaganem]]. He was a member of the party's national bureau until 2013, when he became its official spokesperson.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Abane |first=Meziane |date=20 July 2018 |title=Avec moi, toutes les injustices issues de la décennie noire seront réparées |url=https://www.elwatan.com/edition/actualite/avec-moi-toutes-les-injustices-issues-de-la-decennie-noire-seront-reparees-20-07-2018 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elwatan.com%2Fedition%2Factualite%2Favec-moi-toutes-les-injustices-issues-de-la-decennie-noire-seront-reparees-20-07-2018#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=31 March 2019 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[El Watan]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Guenanfa |first=Hadjer |date=2 May 2018 |title=Entretien avec Fethi Ghares, premier candidat déclaré à la présidentielle de 2019 |url=https://www.tsa-algerie.com/entretien-avec-fethi-ghares-premier-candidat-declare-a-la-presidentielle-de-2019/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tsa-algerie.com%2Fentretien-avec-fethi-ghares-premier-candidat-declare-a-la-presidentielle-de-2019%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=21 February 2025 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=TSA Algérie |language=fr}}</ref> Ghares has described the French West Indian political philosopher [[Frantz Fanon]] as among his biggest influences. In May 2018, he publicly asserted that he supported freedom of conscience, and called for the separation of politics and religion to be enshrined in the [[Constitution of Algeria|Algerian constitution]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Hamouchene |first=Hamza |date=12 June 2021 |title=In Algeria’s Freedom Struggle, the Spirit of Frantz Fanon Is Still Alive |url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250916232437/https://jacobin.com/2021/12/algeria-frantz-fanon-anti-colonialism-france-oppression-extractivism |url-status=live |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20250916232437/https://jacobin.com/2021/12/algeria-frantz-fanon-anti-colonialism-france-oppression-extractivism |archive-date=16 September 2025 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jacobin (magazine)|Jacobin]] |language=en}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=Alilat |first=Farid |date=28 May 2018 |title=Algérie : Fethi Ghares, l'homme qui veut dépoussiérer la gauche |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/mag/560959/politique/algerie-fethi-ghares-lhomme-qui-veut-depoussierer-la-gauche/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2Fmag%2F560959%2Fpolitique%2Falgerie-fethi-ghares-lhomme-qui-veut-depoussierer-la-gauche%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 October 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref>

Ghares is married to Messaouda Cheballah, a member of the executive secretariat of the Democratic and Social Movement.<ref>{{Cite book |url=https://www.hrw.org/sites/default/files/media_2026/01/WR2026%20web_2.pdf |title=World Report 2026 |publisher=[[Human Rights Watch]] |year=2026 |isbn=979-8-88708-274-5 |location=New York City |language=en |access-date=7 February 2026 |archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20260204233950/https://www.hrw.org/sites/default/files/media_2026/01/WR2026%20web_2.pdf |archive-date=4 February 2026 |url-status=live}}</ref>

Ghares announced himself as the Democratic and Social Movement candidate for the [[2019 Algerian presidential election]], though did not submit an official dossier of his candidacy.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Moussaoui |first=Rosa |date=16 November 2018 |title=Maghreb. Fethi Ghares, la promesse d'une Algérie émancipée |url=https://www.humanite.fr/monde/maghreb-fethi-ghares-la-promesse-dune-algerie-emancipee-663739 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.humanite.fr%2Fmaghreb-fethi-ghares-la-promesse-dune-algerie-emancipee-663739#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 October 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[L'Humanité]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=21 January 2019 |title=Présidentielle : Le candidat du MDS Fethi Ghares entame les démarches administratives |url=https://www.elwatan.com/edition/actualite/presidentielle-le-candidat-du-mds-fethi-ghares-entame-les-demarches-administratives-21-01-2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elwatan.com%2Fedition%2Factualite%2Fpresidentielle-le-candidat-du-mds-fethi-ghares-entame-les-demarches-administratives-21-01-2019#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=23 May 2019 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[El Watan]] |language=fr}}</ref> Following the outbreak of the [[Hirak (Algeria)|Hirak]] protests, he renounced his candidacy and instead called for an end to the current Algerian political system, to be replaced with a presidium comprised of four or five independent candidates and the installation of a non-partisan transitional government.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Ouahib |first=Sofia |date=24 May 2019 |title=Après les propos d’Ahmed Gaïd Salah sur le maintien de l’élection présidentielle : La riposte du peuple |url=https://www.elwatan.com/edition/actualite/la-riposte-du-peuple-24-05-2019 |url-status=dead |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.elwatan.com%2Fedition%2Factualite%2Fla-riposte-du-peuple-24-05-2019#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 May 2019 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[El Watan]] |language=fr}}</ref>

In addition to politics, Ghares has also acted in films, including a leading role in ''Révolution Zendj'' by [[Tariq Teguia]].<ref>{{Cite news |last=Regnier |first=Isabelle |date=4 March 2015 |title=« Révolution Zendj » : sous la poussière, les braises des soulèvements passés |url=https://www.lemonde.fr/cinema/article/2015/03/10/revolution-zendj-sous-la-poussiere-les-braises-des-soulevements-passes_4590750_3476.html |url-status=live |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Monde]] |language=fr}}</ref>

=== 2021 arrest and imprisonment ===
On 30 June 2021, Ghares was arrested at his home in [[Djasr Kasentina]] by plainclothes police officers. The [[National Committee for the Liberation of Detainees]] subsequently issued a press release which alleged that, after initially being taken to a police station, Ghares had been returned to his home in order for a search to take place, before being transported to an unknown location.<ref>{{Cite news |date=30 June 2021 |title=Fethi Ghares, président du MDS, arrêté chez lui (CNLD) |url=https://observalgerie.com/2021/06/30/politique/cnld-fethi-ghares-arrete-police/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.observalgerie.com%2F2021%2F06%2F30%2Fpolitique%2Fcnld-fethi-ghares-arrete-police%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=26 October 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=ObservAlgérie |language=fr}}</ref>

On 1 July 2021, Ghares was ordered into pretrial detention by a judge at a court in [[Hammamet, Algiers|Hammamet]].<ref>{{Cite news |date=1 July 2021 |title=URGENT : Fethi Ghares placé sous mandat de dépôt (CNLD) |url=https://observalgerie.com/2021/07/01/politique/cnld-algerie-fethi-ghares-prison/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.observalgerie.com%2F2021%2F07%2F01%2Fpolitique%2Fcnld-algerie-fethi-ghares-prison%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=11 February 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=ObservAlgérie |language=fr}}</ref> His trial was originally scheduled to begin on 6 December, before being delayed to 12 December.<ref>{{Cite news |last=Sankari |first=Lina |date=6 December 2021 |title=Algérie. Fethi Ghares, incarcéré pour ses idées |url=https://www.humanite.fr/algerie-fethi-ghares-incarcere-pour-ses-idees-730102 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.humanite.fr%2Falgerie-fethi-ghares-incarcere-pour-ses-idees-730102#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=13 January 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[L'Humanité]] |language=fr}}</ref> On 9 January 2022, Ghares was sentenced to two years imprisonment on charges of "insulting the President of the Republic", "contempt of a constitutional body", "disseminating publications that could harm the national unity", and "disseminating information that could harm public order". The sentence was criticised by the opposition movement in Algeria.<ref>{{Cite news |date=9 January 2022 |title=Condamnation de Fethi Ghares : les réactions de l'opposition |url=https://www.tsa-algerie.com/condamnation-de-fethi-ghares-les-reactions-de-lopposition/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.tsa-algerie.com%2Fcondamnation-de-fethi-ghares-les-reactions-de-lopposition%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=24 March 2022 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=TSA Algérie |language=fr}}</ref>

In March 2022, Ghares' sentence was reduced to six months imprisonment following a successful appeal, which led to his immediate release from prison. He subsequently publicly commented on conditions at [[El Harrach]] Prison, describing it as "medieval" and stating that no one left it "unscathed".<ref>{{Cite news |last=Alilat |first=Farid |date=28 March 2022 |title=Algérie : Fethi Ghares raconte la prison d'El Harrach |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1334057/politique/algerieaf-fethi-ghares-raconte-la-prison-del-harrach/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2F1334057%2Fpolitique%2Falgerieaf-fethi-ghares-raconte-la-prison-del-harrach%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=9 April 2025 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref>

In February 2023, the Democratic and Social Movement was banned.<ref>{{Cite news |date=29 August 2024 |title=Algérie: l’opposant Fethi Ghares remis en liberté sous contrôle judiciaire |url=https://www.mediapart.fr/journal/fil-dactualites/290824/algerie-l-opposant-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.mediapart.fr%2Fjournal%2Ffil-dactualites%2F290824%2Falgerie-l-opposant-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Mediapart]] |language=fr}}</ref>

=== 2024 arrest and imprisonment ===
On 27 August 2024, Ghares was arrested by plainclothes police officers and transported to an unknown location, according to his wife and the National Committee for the Liberation of Detainees. The arrest happened 15 days before the [[2024 Algerian presidential election]], in which Abdelmadjid Tebboune was seeking a second term. Ghares was accused of "disrupting the election".<ref>{{Cite news |date=28 August 2024 |title=Arrestation de l’opposant algérien Fethi Ghares |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1602576/politique/arrestation-de-lopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2F1602576%2Fpolitique%2Farrestation-de-lopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=K. |first=Yacine |title=Fethi Ghares (coordinateur du MDS) enlevé! |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-coordinateur-du-mds-enleve/?amp=1 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-coordinateur-du-mds-enleve%2F%3Famp%3D1#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |last=K. |first=Yacine |date=28 August 2024 |title=Fethi Ghares retenu au commissariat central d'Alger |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-retenu-au-commissariat-central-dalger/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-retenu-au-commissariat-central-dalger%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref>

On 29 August 2024, Ghares was charged with "insulting the president" and "spreading false information and hate speech through social media posts". He was released from custody and placed under judicial supervision.<ref>{{Cite news |date=30 August 2024 |title=L’opposant algérien Fethi Ghares remis en liberté sous contrôle judiciaire |url=https://www.jeuneafrique.com/1603472/politique/lopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.jeuneafrique.com%2F1603472%2Fpolitique%2Flopposant-algerien-fethi-ghares-remis-en-liberte-sous-controle-judiciaire%2F#& |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Jeune Afrique]] |language=fr}}</ref> In January 2025, Ghares was sentenced to one year in prison and ordered to pay symbolic damages of one [[Algerian dinar|DZD]] to President Tebboune. Ghares' wife received a six-month suspended sentence.<ref>{{Cite news |last=H. |first=Amel |date=19 January 2025 |title=Fethi Ghares et son épouse condamnés à prison ferme pour avoir entravé le processus électoral |url=https://www.algerie360.com/fethi-ghares-et-son-epouse-condamnes-a-prison-ferme-pour-avoir-entrave-le-processus-electoral/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.algerie360.com%2Ffethi-ghares-et-son-epouse-condamnes-a-prison-ferme-pour-avoir-entrave-le-processus-electoral%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=Algerie360 |language=fr}}</ref>

=== 2025 arrest and imprisonment ===
On 29 September 2025, Ghares was arrested for a third time at his home for "insulting the President of the Republic".<ref>{{Cite news |last=Ayache |first=Sofiane |date=29 September 2025 |title=Fethi Ghares arrêté par la police |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-arrete-par-la-police/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-arrete-par-la-police%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref> In October 2025, he was found guilty of "insulting a constituted body" and "disseminating false information undermining public order and national security", and was sentenced to two years imprisonment and a fine of 300, 000 DZD. Ghares remained on provisional release pending the outcome of his appeal of the sentence.<ref>{{Cite news |date=21 October 2025 |title=Fethi Gharès condamné à deux ans de prison ferme |url=https://lematindalgerie.com/fethi-ghares-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme/ |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Flematindalgerie.com%2Ffethi-ghares-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme%2F#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Matin d'Algérie]] |language=fr}}</ref><ref>{{Cite news |date=21 October 2025 |title=Algérie : un opposant de gauche condamné à deux ans de prison ferme pour outrage au président |url=https://www.lefigaro.fr/flash-actu/algerie-un-opposant-de-gauche-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme-pour-outrage-au-president-20251021 |url-status=live |archive-url=https://archive.wikiwix.com/cache/index2.php?url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.lefigaro.fr%2Fflash-actu%2Falgerie-un-opposant-de-gauche-condamne-a-deux-ans-de-prison-ferme-pour-outrage-au-president-20251021#federation=archive.wikiwix.com&tab=url |archive-date=7 February 2026 |access-date=7 February 2026 |work=[[Le Figaro]] |language=fr}}</ref>
